knowledge_base.description: Anxiety is when you feel really worried, nervous, or on edge most of the time, even when there's no real danger. It's like having a constant feeling of unease or fear.
examples: Feeling anxious about taking a test
Going to a party
Speaking in front of a group

knowledge_base.description: Depression is more than just feeling sad—it's feeling sad, hopeless, or empty for a long time. It can affect your energy levels and appetite.
examples: Losing interest in hobbies
Having trouble sleeping
Feeling tired all the time

knowledge_base.description: Bipolar disorder involves extreme mood swings, from feeling really high and energetic (mania or hypomania) to feeling really low and sad (depression).
examples: Feeling like you have endless energy (mania)
Struggling to get out of bed (depression)

knowledge_base.description: OCD involves having unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and compulsive behaviors to make them go away.
examples: Washing hands repeatedly due to fear of germs
Checking locks repeatedly to make sure they’re secure

knowledge_base.description: PTSD develops after experiencing or witnessing a traumatic event and can cause flashbacks, nightmares, or feeling on edge.
examples: Veterans experiencing PTSD after combat
Nightmares or being startled by loud noises

knowledge_base.description: Schizophrenia is a serious mental illness that affects how a person thinks, feels, and behaves. People with schizophrenia may experience hallucinations or delusions.
examples: Hearing voices that aren’t there
Believing you are being watched or controlled

knowledge_base.description: Eating disorders involve unhealthy behaviors towards food and weight that affect physical and mental health.
examples: Anorexia nervosa: Restricting food intake
Bulimia nervosa: Binge-eating and purging
Binge-eating disorder: Eating large amounts of food in a short time

knowledge_base.description: ADHD affects attention, impulse control, and activity levels, making it difficult to focus or sit still.
examples: Having trouble paying attention in school
Struggling to stay organized

knowledge_base.description: Personality disorders involve long-term patterns of thinking and behaving that cause problems in relationships and daily life.
examples: Borderline personality disorder: Unstable relationships and impulsivity
Narcissistic personality disorder: Exaggerated sense of self-importance
Antisocial personality disorder: Disregard for others' rights

knowledge_base.description: Substance use disorders involve continued use of drugs or alcohol despite negative consequences.
examples: Continuing to drink heavily even after losing a job
Using drugs despite health or legal issues
